p: IRIS is another hyperinflammatory syndrome with pathogenesis dependent on CD4 + T cells, proinflammatory cytokines, macrophages and other innate immune cells. IRIS is a phenomenon described in human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) patients with severe lymphopenia and underlying opportunistic infections, occurring during immune recovery upon initiation of antiretrovirals and presenting as worsened clinical manifestations of a preexisting infection or unmasking of a clinically silent infection [11].
